meanings.definition: In or into a position of being enclosed or surrounded by something.
meanings.sent1: The cat hid inwith the bushes during the storm.
meanings.sent2: She placed the gift inwith the box before wrapping it.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel got stuck inwith the hollow tree trunk and couldn't escape.
meanings.sent4: The treasure was hidden inwith the old, abandoned house.
meanings.sent5: The explorer found himself inwith a dense jungle, filled with unknown creatures.

meanings.definition: To be in close association or relationship with someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He enjoys being inwith his best friend at school.
meanings.sent2: The dog loves to be inwith its owner all the time.
meanings.sent3: The book characters seem to be inwith each other's adventures.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in the garden are inwith the bees that pollinate them.
meanings.sent5: The musician feels inwith the rhythm of the music while performing on stage.
